revision.text: {|{{Infobox Aircraft Begin | name=Exxtacy | image=Rigid touch-down.jpg | caption=Exxtacy, showing flaps, flares for landing }}{{Infobox Aircraft Type | type=[[Hang glider]] | national origin=[[Germany]] | manufacturer=[[Flight Design]] | designer= | first flight= | introduced=1999 | retired= | status=Production completed | primary user= | more users= | produced= | number built= | program cost= | unit cost= [[Euro|€]]6078 (Exxtacy 13.5 model, 2003) | developed from= | variants with their own articles= }} |} The '''Flight Design Exxtacy''' is a [[Germany|German]] [[high-wing]], single or two-place, rigid-wing [[hang glider]] that was designed and produced by [[Flight Design]].Bertrand, Noel; Rene Coulon; et al: ''World Directory of Leisure Aviation 2003-04'', page 44. Pagefast Ltd, Lancaster OK, 2003. ISSN 1368-485X{{cite web|url = http://www.deutsches-museum.de/en/flugwerft/collections/hanggliders/exxtacy/|title = Flight Design Exxtacy|accessdate = 17 February 2012|last = [[Deutsches Museum]]|date = n.d.}} Production is complete and the aircraft is no longer available. ==Design and development== The Exxtacy was intended as a high-performance rigid-wing hang glider, for competition use and [[Flight training|two-place instruction]]. The Exxtacy wing is based upon a [[carbon-fiber-reinforced polymer]] cantilever box [[spar (aviation)|spar]], with [[Rib (aircraft)|ribs]] and [[wing tip]]s, also of the same material. Control is by weight-shift, with roll control augmented by wing top-surface [[Spoiler (aeronautics)|spoilers]]. For thermalling flight and landing, inboard [[Flap (aircraft)|flaps]] were installed. The aircraft achieves a [[glide ratio]] of 17.5:1. The aircraft can be dismantled for ground transport and folds to {{convert|5.70|m|ft|1|abbr=on}} x {{convert|0.26|m|ft|1|abbr=on}} x {{convert|0.52|m|ft|1|abbr=on}}. ==Variants== ;Exxtacy 13.5 :Single place model. Its {{convert|11.4|m|ft|1|abbr=on}} span wing has a nose angle of 165° and the [[aspect ratio (wing)|aspect ratio]] is 9.4:1. The pilot hook-in weight range is {{convert|90|to|140|kg|lb|0|abbr=on}}. In 2003 the aircraft sold for [[Euro|€]]6078. Certified as DHV Class 3. ;Exxtacy Biplace :Two place model. Its {{convert|12.2|m|ft|1|abbr=on}} span wing has a nose angle of 165° and the aspect ratio is 10.05:1. The pilot hook-in weight range is {{convert|100|to|160|kg|lb|0|abbr=on}}. In 2003 the aircraft sold for [[Euro|€]]6509.
